profile_positions.description: By working with senior leaders at the center, regional, and national levels to achieve programmatic and operational goals while managing risk to staff and supporting organizational interventions in Hard-to-Reach areas with successful humanitarian negotiations and access strategies, provide guidance on creating a culture of effective and practical risk management for staff safety and security. Additionally, provide all strategic and operational support to the regions and countries by translating the organizational vision, mission and strategies to maximize the organizational outreach to the most vulnerable population by adopting integrated risk management approach. Develop staff capacity across the organization to identify safety and security risks, adapt to changes in circumstances, and respond critical situations including crisis and supporting humanitarian interventions in catastrophes. Close liaising and coordination with the relevant industries pertaining to the role that includes but not limited to the risk management, insurance, travel management, and security, as well as industry trends and best practices. Maintain key relationships with peer organizations and service providers to stay abreast of trends in global health, safety, and security trends, ensuring that Save the Children strategies can respond quickly and effectively to emergent situations. Maintain detailed knowledge of the national and regional security and operating environments where Save the Children strategies works, the changing security dynamics and trends, and their effect on field operations and program implementation.
profile_positions.title: Global Security and Access Manager Save the Children International

profile_positions.description: Provide technical advice and leadership on access, health safety and security management affairs across the Asia region. Provide support to different Save the Children country programs that includes but not limited to; Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Philippines, Nepal, Bhutan, China, Pakistan, and Myanmar. Enable national offices in implementing sound access, safety & security strategy and practices. Enhance safety & security of Save the Children staff, programs and assets to minimize operational, organizational and reputational risks, and having supporting the country offices to have relevant business continuity and contingency plans in place. Conducting in depth investigations involving fraud, theft, threats, workplace violence, internal violations and all other incidents that are affecting the organization and providing accurate, timely, comprehensive reports of investigations.
profile_positions.title: Regional Security Director-Asia

profile_positions.description: Provide support to Senior Regional Safety and Security Director to ensure the implementation of effective safety and security management standards and practices in Save the Children International country offices across the Asia region. I had been supporting the country safety and security focal points and working closely with them to ensure that the compliance to the SCI global safety and security standards are ensured and appropriate systems are in place at country level. Additionally, supports Country Office safety & security management procedures consistent with SCI Safety and Security Policy conducting safety and security related assessments; and reviewing and analyzing incident reports and security updates. In addition, be available to deploy to SCI declared humanitarian emergencies to ensure safety and security management is addressing emergency response needs. Also, provides training for SCI Regional Office and Country Offices staff throughout Asia.

profile_positions.description: Ensuring effective access, health safety and Security management systems and practices in place across the country program to minimize risks and providing support to programs for business continuity; Designing, implementing and managing security policies, procedures and infrastructures for the programs and responses to maximize staff safety and security; protection of assets and safer delivery of programs; providing inputs in program development life cycle; providing leadership, technical and management support to the safety & security team of 24 full-time safety & security professionals deputed across the country program and building their capacity; delivery of trainings to the staff as well as partner organizations; negotiating access and having effective stakeholders engagement strategy in place; and actively contributing in country strategic and operational planning and critical decision making as a member of Senior Management Team (SMT).

As a key member of safety and security team, to train staff on safety and security management and other essential trainings including personal safety and security awareness training, etc.
